page.title: 17WILLEN CHURCH MILTON KEYNES
page.content: Willen Church was built in 1680 by Robert Hooke. He named the church ST Mary Magdalene. The church stands on small mound opposite Willen Priory.Inside the church is a marble font with a hand carved oak cover into it. The outside of the church is black and red brick with limestone dressing. The church does have a belltower,with three bells in it. The grounds of the church are not very big, but they contain quite a lot of graves, neatly taken care of. The oldest gravestone there is dated 1672. There is a long gravel pathway leading up to the church. On either side of the path are trees and bushes.
